programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon’s guide to home cooking continues as he shows us how to serve up great food that really packs a big and bold punch.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon’s ultimate home cooking continues as he reworks his favourite classic recipes giving them a fantastic modern twist.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon’s ultimate home cooking is inspired by French cuisine, the food Gordon first fell in love with as a chef. Recipes include a wonderful Tuna Nicoise salad.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.sub-title: When the Wall Comes Tumbling Down
programme.desc: The chefs prepare their signature dishes and compete in the first team challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The teams compete in the first "Hell's Kitchen" Grand Prix crepe-making challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The teams are challenged to cook eight ostrich dishes, using the most popular ostrich meats, in forty minutes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs have to team up for a surf and turf protein relay.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay heads to Scottsdale to fix a failing restaurant with nauseating food and inadequate service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in Scottsdale at Amy's Baking Company. Enjoy unseen clips and reaction to Gordon's first visit.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: A restaurant owner touts his pizza as the best in Denver, but local residents have other ideas.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: The Vienna owner's Jonathan and Lisa Krach are at their breaking point and have become trapped in their Austrian themed hotel, drowning in debt. Gordon discovers some shocking rumors about the owners and the real reason customers have stopped coming.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Newtown in Pennsylvania, to try and save a historic hotel that is desperately in need of help. Verindar, the owner, runs the hotel like an angry tyrant. Her staff is ready to quit because they are so unhappy with the way they are treated.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: After a shocking elimination, the final two chefs receive unexpected help for their final menus.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The finalists prep menus and plan for the biggest event taking place at Six Flags Magic Mountain.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay coaches another selection of hopeful chefs, with a job and $250,000 going to the winner.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The competition continues as the contestants try to land $250,000 and a job at Hell's Kitchen Lake Tahoe.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon shows us how to make his ultimate food on a budget. Recipes include flavourful sausage rice, roasted mackerel with garlic and paprika and unforgettable lamb with fried bread.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon turns his focus to home baking. Recipes include his flavour-packed olive, tomato and rosemary focaccia, quick flatbreads with lemon, thyme and ricotta and a spectacular sponge with fresh ginger.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula shows us how to make three dishes that are staples for any Southern table.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula cooks some time saving dishes that help even the busiest of families enjoy weeknight meals together!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula and some special guests give us the "low" down on why shrimp from Georgia are some of the best in the world!

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha prepares onion dishes with different cooking techniques: French onion soup, balsamic-glazed pearl onions, and fried onion rings. Plus, pickled Vidalia and red onions.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Roasting is a technique used for both formal dinners and casual gatherings. Martha makes roast rack of lamb, salt-roasted sea bass, and saffron-roasted chicken wings.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Oodles of noodles! Watch Martha make three of her favorites: Pad Thai, a one pan pasta that's on the table in twenty minutes, and pho, considered Vietnam's national dish.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril hosts culinary students from his alma mater, Johnson Wales University: how to make chicken and smoked sausage gumbo. Plus, how to make a roux and perfect white rice.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril's Restaurant in New Orleans recipes: quail Milton with wild mushroom andouille duxelles and banana cream pie.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Join Emeril for a Mexican birthday fiesta! Classic frozen Margaritas and chorizo, cheese, and green chile enchiladas. Plus, a sopapillas, traditional Mexican dessert.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make Grilled Sausage and Peppers and Christie makes Ballpark Pretzels.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan makes North Carolina Dipped Fried Chicken and Ashley makes North Carolina Lemon Pie.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make fried chicken wings on the grill. Bryan makes grilled pork burgers.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula and the boys continue to reminisce with some Mac and Cheese, a delicious Cucumber Salad and Paula's famous Banana Pudding.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Bobby Deen stops by and Paula prepares his favorite all-time meal!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.sub-title: Home is Where the Heart Is - Part 1
programme.desc: Paula recreates a beautiful and tasty cake she had on a trip to her hometown of Albany, Georgia.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Butcher Evan Lobel joins Martha for a master class on meat. Learn how to choose and prepare the best cuts of meat to save you money.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Starting with a perfect pot of fluffy white rice, Martha demonstrates her techniques for a flavorful pilaf and a delicious Thai-style fried rice.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Homemade dressings don't compare to store-bought. Martha shows you how easy it is to make your own: vinaigrette, creamy blue cheese dressing, homemade mayonnaise, and aioli.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Steaming is one of the fastest and healthiest ways to cook. Martha shows how to cook in parchment paper, clean and steam mussels, and use a bamboo steamer to prepare salmon and peas.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Roasting is an adaptable technique that works well for meat, fish, chicken, and vegetables. Martha prepares roast chicken, beef tenderloin, and autumn vegetable salad.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: With little hands-on time and no special equipment, braising produces hearty, flavorful dishes. Martha shares recipes for pot roast, braised cabbage, and pulled pork shoulder.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha demonstrates healthful and versatile poached chicken breasts. She also shares recipes and techniques for poaching salmon and poaching eggs.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon’s guide to the ultimate home cooking continues as he shows us how to make deliciously healthy food.
